textDetail.text:
Triangular Sum: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block">
                <mtable displaystyle="true">
                <mtr>
                <mtd>
                <mn>1</mn>
                <mo>+</mo>
                <mn>2</mn>
                <mo>+</mo>
                <mn>3</mn>
                <mo>+</mo>
                <mn>4</mn>
                <mo>+</mo>
                <mo>⋯</mo>
                <mo>+</mo>
                <mi>n</mi>
                <mo>=</mo>
                <mfrac>
                <mrow>
                <mo stretchy="false"></mo>
                <mi>n</mi>
                <mo>⁢</mo>
                <mrow>
                <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
                <mrow>
                <mi>n</mi>
                <mo>+</mo>
                <mn>1</mn>
                </mrow>
                <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
                </mrow>
                </mrow>
                <mi>2</mi>
                </mfrac>
                </mtd>
                </mtr>
                </mtable>
                </math>

Stirling's Approximation: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" display="block">
                <mtable displaystyle="true">
                <mtr>
                <mtd>
                <mi>lg</mi>
                <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
                <mi>n!</mi>
                <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
                <mo>=</mo>
                <mi>lg</mi>
                <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
                <mn>1</mn>
                <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
                <mo>+</mo>
                <mi>lg</mi>
                <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
                <mn>2</mn>
                <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
                <mo>+</mo>
                <mi>lg</mi>
                <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
                <mn>3</mn>
                <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
                <mo>+</mo>
                <mi>lg</mi>
                <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
                <mn>4</mn>
                <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
                <mo>+</mo>
                <mo>⋯<!-- ⋯ --></mo>
                <mo>+</mo>
                <mi>lg</mi>
                <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
                <mi>n</mi>
                <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
                </mtd>
                </mtr>
                </mtable>
                </math>

questions.answer: Grouping can change. For instance, addition: (a + b) + c == a + (b + c).
Order can change. For instance, addition: a + b == b + a.
Operations can be applied to members of a group. For instance, multiplication over addition: a × (b + c)  =  a × b + a × c.
a related to b and b related to c implies a related to c. For instance, less than: If a < b and b < c, then a < c.
Related to itself. For instance, equality: a == a.
Related in both directions. For instance, equality: if a == b then b == a.
